question: Post-trading disclosures for a trading venue such as the London Stock Exchange do NOT require the venue to publish which of the following in relation to transactions in liquid equity securities?
correctAnswer: Counterparties
insight: Post-trading disclosures typically include price, volume, and time to ensure transparency, but counterparties are not disclosed to protect privacy.

question: Standard settlement for an equity transaction on the London Stock Exchange is:
insight: T+2 is the standard settlement period for equity transactions on the London Stock Exchange, balancing efficiency and risk.

question: To comply with the Conduct of Business rules for communications with a retail client it is NOT necessary for an authorised firm to give the client:
options: Notification when any product offered places the client’s capital at risk
Information that the Financial Conduct Authority is the regulator
The maximum return possible over the investment period whenever a yield figure is given
A fair, clear and not misleading impression of the producer or manager of any underlying investments of any packaged products offered
correctAnswer: The maximum return possible over the investment period whenever a yield figure is given
insight: COBS rules focus on risk disclosure and clarity, but maximum return projections are not mandatory.

question: In respect of a Lasting power of attorney (LPA) taken out in 2024, the LPA:
options: Must be registered with the Office of Public Guardian
Must be registered with the Financial Conduct Authority
Must be registered with the Office of the Lord Chancellor
correctAnswer: Must be registered with the Office of Public Guardian
insight: LPAs must be registered with the Office of Public Guardian to be legally effective in the UK.

question: A professional client can be treated as a ‘qualified investor’ if they have:
options: A security portfolio of €750,000 and have worked for seven months in a professional capacity in the financial sector requiring knowledge of security investment
Carried out thirty-five security market transactions over €10,000 in the last year and a security portfolio of €1,200,000

Carried out an average of fifteen security market transactions over €1,000 for the last four quarters and worked for thirteen months in a professional capacity in the financial sector requiring knowledge of security investment
correctAnswer: Carried out an average of fifteen security market transactions over €1,000 for the last four quarters and worked for thirteen months in a professional capacity in the financial sector requiring knowledge of security investment
insight: Qualified investor criteria include transaction frequency and professional experience, as defined by regulatory standards.

question: The financial state where a company is temporarily unable to pay its bills would be best described as:
correctAnswer: Insolvency
insight: Insolvency refers to a temporary inability to meet financial obligations, distinct from bankruptcy or dissolution.

question: Which of the following will require Part 4A authorisation if carrying out a regulated activity in the UK?
options: An appointed representative of an authorised person
correctAnswer: A broker
insight: Brokers performing regulated activities in the UK require Part 4A authorisation under FSMA.

question: Which of the following actions by the senior management of a company is least likely to promote ethical employee behaviour?
options: Holding project teams and individual members of the team responsible for unethical behaviour.
Providing clear instructions on compliance procedures.
Providing consistent procedures addressing areas of conflict of interest.
Putting in place a system of high rewards for high level of performance irrespective of the associated risk.
correctAnswer: Putting in place a system of high rewards for high level of performance irrespective of the associated risk.
insight: Rewarding performance without considering risk can encourage unethical behavior.

question: Which of the following is NOT a way by which a contract can be ended?
correctAnswer: Intention
insight: Contracts end via breach, frustration, or agreement, but intention alone is not a recognized termination method.

question: A deposit taking bank in the UK will be regulated by:
options: Neither the Financial Conduct Authority nor the Prudential Regulation Authority
Both the Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential Regulation Authority
correctAnswer: Both the Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential Regulation Authority
insight: Deposit-taking banks are dual-regulated by the FCA (conduct) and PRA (prudential).

question: Which of the following is most accurate if a joint tenant wishes to dispose of their interest during their lifetime?
options: They are free to dispose of their share of the property at any time
They can dispose of their share of the property immediately after giving notice to the other joint tenant(s)
They can dispose of their share of the property after giving notice to the other joint tenant(s) and converting to a tenancy in common
They can only dispose of their share of the property when the other joint tenant(s) dispose of their share
correctAnswer: They can dispose of their share of the property after giving notice to the other joint tenant(s) and converting to a tenancy in common
insight: Joint tenancy requires conversion to tenancy in common to dispose of individual shares.

question: Under the FCA’s disclosure and transparency rules (DTR), a person discharging managerial responsibility (PDMR) undertaking a personal transaction in the relevant listed company must notify:
options: The market within two business days of the transaction
The market within four business days of the transaction
The listed company within two business days of the transaction
The listed company within four business days of the transaction
correctAnswer: The listed company within four business days of the transaction
insight: DTR requires PDMRs to notify the company within four business days for transparency.

question: Tony is employed as a salesman by a company. The company has provided him with a car which Tony uses for business and for personal use. The class of National Insurance Contributions that the company has to pay is:
correctAnswer: Class 1A contributions
insight: Class 1A NICs are paid by employers on benefits in kind, like company cars.

question: A UK listed company has only ordinary shares in issue. Who may demand a poll at a general meeting?
options: One member with 5% or more of the votes that may be cast at the meeting.
One member with 10% or more of the votes that may be cast at the meeting.
No fewer than three members, irrespective of the votes held.
The Chairman of the company only.
correctAnswer: One member with 10% or more of the votes that may be cast at the meeting.
insight: UK company law allows shareholders with 10% voting rights to demand a poll.

question: The stage of money laundering where funds originally gained from criminal activity are used for a legitimate activity in the economy after having been laundered is known as:
correctAnswer: Integration
insight: Integration is the final stage of money laundering, where cleaned funds enter the legitimate economy.

question: Which of these roles is warranted by a free-market government or its agencies?
correctAnswer: Regulating firms
insight: Governments regulate firms to ensure market fairness and stability.

question: Who must a firm’s data controller notify if they wish to handle personal client information?
correctAnswer: The Information Commissioner’s Office
insight: The ICO oversees data protection compliance in the UK.

question: Which decision made by an investment manager is considered to be the most important determinant of performance over the long term?
correctAnswer: Asset allocation
insight: Asset allocation drives long-term portfolio performance more than other factors.

question: Simplified Due Diligence (SDD) may be applied to which of the following?
options: Business with beneficiaries of solicitor’s accounts
Where business is conducted on a non face-to-face basis
In respect of correspondent banking relationships
correctAnswer: Business with beneficiaries of solicitor’s accounts
insight: SDD is applicable to low-risk scenarios, such as solicitor accounts.

question: Which of the following is most accurate regarding Standard VI B of the CFA Standards of Professional Conduct: Priority of Transactions?
options: Investment transactions where a member is the beneficial owner have priority over transactions for clients
Investment transactions for clients have priority over transactions where a member or employers are the beneficial owner
Investment transactions for clients and employers have priority over transactions where a member is the beneficial owner
Investment transactions for employers have priority over transactions where a member or their client is the beneficial owner
correctAnswer: Investment transactions for clients and employers have priority over transactions where a member is the beneficial owner
insight: CFA Standard VI B prioritizes client and employer transactions over personal ones.

question: Which of the Principles for Business requires a firm to ‘take reasonable care to ensure the suitability of its advice and discretionary decisions for any customer who is entitled to rely upon its judgements’?
correctAnswer: Principle 9: Customers: relationships of trust
insight: FCA Principle 9 ensures suitability of advice for clients.

question: Which of the following acquisitions by an investor would require them to notify the company within two business days?
options: An investor acquiring 2% when they already hold 0.5%
An investor acquiring 0.3% when they already hold 5.8%
An investor acquiring 2.7% when they already hold 0.2%
An investor acquiring 0.5% when they already hold 7.2%
correctAnswer: An investor acquiring 0.3% when they already hold 5.8%
insight: DTR requires notification for crossing certain ownership thresholds, like 6%.

question: If Tom and Jayne sell the modern art sculpture and Tom realises no other gains or losses in 2024/25, what is the highest sale price (ignoring costs) that can be achieved before Tom will have to pay a capital gain charge?
insight: The CGT annual exempt amount determines the tax-free sale price.

question: If Jayne and Tom sell their holiday property, what would be the capital gains tax payable by Jayne in 2024/25 if she makes no other disposals this tax year?
insight: CGT is calculated based on the gain minus exemptions and taxed at the applicable rate.

question: In 2024/25 Tom’s Oplon plc shares paid out a total gross dividend of £560. How much tax must Tom pay on his dividend income?
insight: Dividend tax depends on the taxpayer’s income and allowances.

question: How much will be Jayne’s total income tax liability for 2024/25?
insight: Income tax liability is calculated based on taxable income and rates.

question: Jayne is thinking of investing some of her savings in an enterprise investment scheme (EIS) what would be the maximum income tax relief she can receive due to the EIS investment?
options: 10% on an investment of up to £100,000
30% on an investment of up to £100,000
10% on an investment of up to £1 million
30% on an investment of up to £1 million
correctAnswer: 30% on an investment of up to £1 million
insight: EIS offers 30% income tax relief up to £1 million investment.

question: If Jayne sells her entire holding of Drisco plc shares at £1.54 in dematerialised form then how much stamp duty reserve tax will be due on the transaction?
insight: Dematerialised share transactions may be exempt from SDRT in certain cases.

question: Stamp duty reserve tax is NOT paid on purchases of which of the following?
options: Shares in a UK company listed on AIM
Shares in a UK company listed on the London Stock Exchange
UK registered shares in a foreign company
An option to buy a share in a UK company
correctAnswer: Shares in a UK company listed on AIM
insight: AIM shares are exempt from SDRT to encourage investment.

question: How many calendar days of notice must a public company give when they call a general meeting?
insight: UK company law requires 14 days’ notice for general meetings of public companies.

question: Which of the following is least correct regarding Eurobonds?
options: They may be settled via Euroclear
ICMA rules specify T+3 settlement of eurobonds
They may be settled via Clearstream
correctAnswer: ICMA rules specify T+3 settlement of eurobonds
insight: ICMA does not mandate T+3; settlement periods vary.

question: The fund charges which are likely to have the greatest impact on an investor’s returns over the long term are:
correctAnswer: Annual management charges
insight: Annual management charges compound over time, impacting long-term returns.

question: Wilfred is an investment manager for a wealth management firm. He receives research from analysts at his firm recommending a ‘sell’ for shares in a company called Techy Tech Industries plc. He then sells his own personal holding of Techy Tech shares before disseminating the recommendation to his clients. In doing so he has:
options: Not violated any of the CFA Standards of Professional Conduct
Violated Standard VIB: Priority of transactions
Violated Standard VB: Communication with clients and prospective clients
correctAnswer: Violated Standard VIB: Priority of transactions
insight: CFA Standard VI B prohibits personal transactions ahead of client transactions.

question: The body of the Bank of England responsible for protecting and enhancing financial stability is the:
correctAnswer: Financial Policy Committee
insight: The FPC oversees systemic financial stability in the UK.

question: Which of these would be most likely to be considered by the FCA to be examples of good practice when carrying out a fact find?
options: Gathering contradictory information relating to a customer’s attitude to risk
Recommending customers to make use of a number of ISAs in the same tax year due to incomplete records
A customer’s tax position not being fully considered
Updating Know Your Customer information on a bi-annual basis
correctAnswer: Updating Know Your Customer information on a bi-annual basis
insight: Regular KYC updates ensure accurate client data.

question: The Panel on Takeovers and Mergers levy is payable on a trade of over £10,000 of which type of securities (of a company incorporated in the UK and admitted for trading on a UK regulated market)?
correctAnswer: American depositary receipts
insight: The Takeover Panel levy applies to certain securities like ADRs.

question: Which of these least accurately represents a benefit for an investor in a venture capital trust (VCT)?
options: Tax free dividends over any holding period
A tax reduction of 30% of the amount invested whatever the holding period
Capital gains tax free gains on sale of shares over any holding period
The VCT itself has tax exempt capital gains
correctAnswer: A tax reduction of 30% of the amount invested whatever the holding period
insight: VCT tax relief is subject to holding period requirements.

question: A firm adopting an alternative approach for its treatment of client money is required to send in writing to the FCA confirmation:
options: That the Board is satisfied the firm meets alternative approach requirements.
That the Board is satisfied the normal approach would not be appropriate given the firm’s business environment.
From the firm’s external auditors that it has in place the required systems and controls to operate an alternative approach.
From the firm’s compliance officer that it has in place the required systems and controls to operate an alternative approach.
correctAnswer: From the firm’s external auditors that it has in place the required systems and controls to operate an alternative approach.
insight: External auditor confirmation ensures compliance with FCA rules.

question: Where a firm manages investments (excluding derivatives) on behalf of a retail client, it must normally provide a periodic statement every:
correctAnswer: 6 months
insight: FCA rules mandate periodic statements every 6 months for retail clients.

question: An authorised person is prohibited by FSMA 2000 from marketing unregulated collective investment schemes (UCIS) to:
options: A retail client with net investable assets of £200,000 and annual income of £90,000
correctAnswer: A retail client with net investable assets of £200,000 and annual income of £90,000
insight: FSMA restricts UCIS marketing to retail clients unless they meet specific criteria.

question: A firm that approves a financial promotion regarding an occupational pension scheme must retain adequate records for how long?
correctAnswer: Six years
insight: FCA requires six-year retention for pension-related financial promotion records.

question: What name is given to the document which is produced for retail investors in collective investment schemes under the terms of UK UCITS?
correctAnswer: Key Investor Information Document
insight: KIID is a standardized document for UCITS retail investors.

question: A systematic internaliser is an investment firm which executes customer orders in liquid shares on:
options: Either a regulated market or a multilateral trading facility
A regulated market but not on a multilateral trading facility
A multilateral trading facility but not on a regulated market
Neither a regulated market nor on a multilateral trading facility
correctAnswer: Neither a regulated market nor on a multilateral trading facility
insight: Systematic internalisers execute orders off-exchange.

question: If John gives a yacht to his daughter but continues to use it as if it were his own, it would be known for inheritance tax purposes as a:
correctAnswer: Gift with reservation
insight: A gift with reservation retains IHT liability if the donor continues to benefit.

question: Which regulatory body is responsible for overseeing the systemic infrastructure of central counterparties, securities settlement systems, and recognised payment systems?
correctAnswer: Bank of England
insight: The Bank of England oversees critical financial infrastructure.

question: Which of the following is least likely to be a reason for a company to close its defined benefit pension scheme?
options: An increase in the pension fund deficit
The requirement to disclose the funding position of the fund in the company accounts
An increase in return on assets held by the scheme
An increase in the longevity of the fund members
correctAnswer: An increase in return on assets held by the scheme
insight: Higher asset returns reduce pension deficits, making closure less likely.

question: Which of these securities is most likely to meet an investor’s need to meet regular operating expenses plus unexpected liquidity requirements as they arise?
correctAnswer: Short term government bonds
insight: Short-term government bonds offer liquidity and stability for operating expenses.

question: Which of these factors would allow a company to be treated as a per se professional client in relation to MiFID business?
options: Own funds of €2.5 million and a balance sheet total of €21 million
Balance sheet total of €11 million and net turnover of €50 million
Net turnover of €45 million and own funds of €1 million
Net turnover of €25 million and a balance sheet total of €45 million
correctAnswer: Own funds of €2.5 million and a balance sheet total of €21 million
insight: MiFID professional client criteria include specific financial thresholds.

question: Which of the following factors would least likely allow a company to be exempt from the need to publish a prospectus when issuing securities?
options: The company is offering securities to 100 persons other than qualified investors
The shares represent 8% of the number of shares of a class already admitted for trading on the same exchange
The minimum consideration per investor is €70,000
The offer is made to qualified investors only
correctAnswer: The minimum consideration per investor is €70,000
insight: Prospectus exemptions apply to qualified investors or small share offerings.

question: A firm that is subject to a penalty by the FCA can appeal the decision through:
options: The Upper Tribunal (Tax and Chancery Chamber)
correctAnswer: The Upper Tribunal (Tax and Chancery Chamber)
insight: FCA penalties can be appealed via the Upper Tribunal.

question: How often does the FCA require that a firm must conduct external reconciliations between its internal accounts and the accounts of a third-party holding client money on behalf of the firm?
correctAnswer: As often as is necessary
insight: FCA requires reconciliations based on risk and necessity.

question: Which of the following is least likely to be considered a solution to the ‘principal – agency’ problem’?
options: Incentivising managers in the form of shares
Monitoring of managers by the board of directors
correctAnswer: Firms operating with dual capacity
insight: Dual capacity does not address principal-agent conflicts.

question: All of the following are requirements for a company to be a High Growth Segment (HGS) company except:
options: a minimum free float of 10% at IPO
being incorporated in the European Economic Area
having historic revenue of 20% on a compound annual growth rate basis over three years
being a non-commercial company, issuing only equity shares
correctAnswer: being a non-commercial company, issuing only equity shares
insight: HGS companies can be commercial and issue various securities.

question: If a person dies without having written a will then their estate will be:
options: distributed according to the laws of probate
sold and the proceeds revert to the treasury
distributed according to the laws of intestacy
distributed in line with a judge’s decision
correctAnswer: distributed according to the laws of intestacy
insight: Intestacy laws govern estate distribution without a will.

question: Which of the following is least correct regarding the Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS)?
options: The maximum money award by the FOS is £100,000
If a complaint is unresolved by a firm within eight weeks, the complainant can refer the complaint to the FOS
Certain types of complaints are covered by compulsory jurisdiction of the FOS for regulated firms
The ombudsman may dismiss a complaint without considering its merit if it is satisfied the complainant has not suffered financial loss, material inconvenience or material distress
correctAnswer: The maximum money award by the FOS is £100,000
insight: FOS award limits are higher than £100,000 as of recent updates.

question: The General Data Protection Regulation is least likely to require that an individual’s personal information held by a firm is:
options: Kept for as long as the firm might find it useful
Processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner
correctAnswer: Kept for as long as the firm might find it useful
insight: GDPR limits data retention to what is necessary.

question: Which of the following is most likely to be described as operating as a sell side firm?
correctAnswer: A broker
insight: Brokers facilitate transactions, typical of sell-side firms.

question: When does Standard IIIE of the CFA Standards of Professional Conduct, Preservation of Confidentiality NOT require that information about clients be kept confidential?
options: (i) When the client permits disclosure of the information
(ii) When disclosure is required by law
(iii) When the information concerns illegal activities on the part of the client
correctAnswer: (i), (ii) and (iii)
insight: CFA Standard III E allows disclosure in these specific cases.

question: Which form of trust is most commonly used for a beneficiary who is a child?
correctAnswer: Bare trust
insight: Bare trusts are simple and suitable for child beneficiaries.

question: According to FCA rules, which of the following is most likely to be classed as a certified high net worth investor?
options: An investor with annual income of £60,000 and net investable assets of £300,000
An investor with annual income of £90,000 and net investable assets of £200,000
An investor with annual income of £100,000 and net investable assets of £280,000
An investor with annual income of £125,000 and net investable assets of £210,000
correctAnswer: An investor with annual income of £100,000 and net investable assets of £280,000
insight: FCA defines high net worth based on income and asset thresholds.

question: How long must a firm keep records of a client agreement associated with a pension transfer?
options: The duration of the client relationship
correctAnswer: Indefinitely
insight: Pension transfer records must be kept indefinitely due to long-term liabilities.

question: Clare Batley is a fund manager. She receives a text from a friend who works for Yardstone Pharmaceuticals saying that Yardstone is going to announce that they have had regulatory approval to release an important new drug turned down. Clare immediately sells all Yardstone shares held by the fund she manages. In doing so she has:
options: Not violated any of the CFA Standards of Professional Conduct
Violated Standard IIA, Material non-public information
correctAnswer: Violated Standard IIA, Material non-public information
insight: Trading on insider information violates CFA Standard II A.

question: The role played by the financial services industry in reducing the cost of capital for businesses and consumers is best described as facilitating the:
options: Pooling of capital and the management of risk.
Pooling of capital risk with capital returns.
Separation of capital providers from capital consumers.
Separation of capital risk from capital returns.
correctAnswer: Pooling of capital and the management of risk.
insight: Financial services reduce capital costs through risk management and pooling.

question: Which of these questions would be most likely to be answered with a soft fact?
options: How much do you earn annually?
How do you feel about your current investments?
What is your date of birth?
correctAnswer: How do you feel about your current investments?
insight: Soft facts relate to subjective feelings or preferences.

question: Which of the following is an ancillary service under MiFID?
options: Managing portfolios of investments in financial instruments
correctAnswer: Services relating to underwriting
insight: Underwriting is an ancillary service under MiFID.

question: Which act of parliament establishes the framework that protects employees in a case of whistleblowing?
options: The Financial Services and Markets Act
correctAnswer: The Public Interest Disclosure Act
insight: PIDA protects whistleblowers in the UK.

question: Which regulation requires UK persons entering into a derivatives contract to report and risk manage their derivatives position?
options: Undertakings for Collective Investment in Transferable Securities
correctAnswer: UK EMIR
insight: UK EMIR governs derivatives reporting and risk management.

question: Which of the following would NOT be categorized as a Restricted Mass Market Investment (RMMI) by the FCA?
correctAnswer: Exchange-traded fund
insight: ETFs are not classified as RMMI due to their regulated nature.

question: In relation to an occupational pension fund, which of the following will be subject to taxation?
options: Pension payments received from the fund
correctAnswer: Pension payments received from the fund
insight: Pension payments are taxable as income.

question: Which body publishes and operates the UK Stewardship Code?
correctAnswer: The Financial Reporting Council (FRC)
insight: The FRC oversees the UK Stewardship Code.

question: Which of the following statements about pension fund schemes is correct?
options: Defined benefit pension schemes have short term liabilities so they are more likely to invest in short term assets
Defined contribution pension schemes bring greater certainty of the amount of pension to be paid on retirement
Purchasing an annuity on retirement removes longevity risk for the member of a defined contribution pension scheme
There is a greater exposure to longevity risk for members of defined benefit pension schemes
correctAnswer: Purchasing an annuity on retirement removes longevity risk for the member of a defined contribution pension scheme
insight: Annuities mitigate longevity risk in DC schemes.

question: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has a duty to investigate which of the following mergers?
options: One where the target company has a UK turnover of £90 million and the merging companies together supply 20% of goods in their market in the UK
One where the company mounting the takeover has UK turnover of £110 million and the merging companies together supply 24% of goods in their market in the UK
One where the company mounting the takeover has UK turnover of £130 million and the merging companies together supply 28% of goods in their market in the UK
One where the target company has a UK turnover of £69 million and the merging companies together supply 24% of goods in their market in the UK
correctAnswer: One where the company mounting the takeover has UK turnover of £130 million and the merging companies together supply 28% of goods in their market in the UK
insight: CMA investigates mergers meeting turnover and market share thresholds.

question: Yasmin wishes to fully understand the mortgage on Lillian’s flat. To obtain the relevant information from the mortgage lender, Yasmin would be most likely to use which of the following?
correctAnswer: A letter of authority
insight: A letter of authority allows access to mortgage details.

question: What is the maximum tax deferred allowance that Lillian can withdraw from a single premium insurance bond each year?
options: Up to 5% of its current market value only
Up to 5% of its original premium only
Up to 5% of its current market value plus any unused allowance from previous years
Up to 5% of its original premium plus any unused allowance from previous years
correctAnswer: Up to 5% of its original premium plus any unused allowance from previous years
insight: Insurance bonds allow 5% annual withdrawals with carryover.

question: Yasmin learns from the fact-find that Lillian has a high return objective and a long time horizon for investment. Which of the following is the most likely risk tolerance resulting from each of these two facts (taken separately)?
options: Low risk tolerance | Low risk tolerance
Low risk tolerance | High risk tolerance
High risk tolerance | Low risk tolerance
High risk tolerance | High risk tolerance
correctAnswer: High risk tolerance | High risk tolerance
insight: High return objectives and long horizons suggest high risk tolerance.

question: During the fact find Yasmin says she is always concerned about the risk that any investments might be worth less at a future date than when she purchased them. This risk is best described as:
correctAnswer: Capital risk
insight: Capital risk refers to the potential loss of investment value.

question: What must Yasmin provide for Lillian when making the recommendation that she invest in a stakeholder pension scheme?
correctAnswer: Suitability report
insight: A suitability report is required for pension recommendations.

question: A higher-rate taxpayer receives a dividend payment of £13,859 in the 2024/25 tax year. To the nearest pound, how much tax is the investor liable for on this dividend income stream?
insight: Dividend tax for higher-rate taxpayers is calculated at 32.5%.

question: Which of the following is most correct when comparing the investment horizon and liquidity needs of general insurance companies with those of life assurance companies?
options: General insurance companies have longer investment horizons than life assurance companies and greater liquidity needs
General insurance companies have shorter investment horizons than life assurance companies and greater liquidity needs
General insurance companies have longer investment horizons than life assurance companies and lower liquidity needs
General insurance companies have shorter investment horizons than life assurance companies and lower liquidity needs
correctAnswer: General insurance companies have shorter investment horizons than life assurance companies and greater liquidity needs
insight: General insurance requires shorter horizons and higher liquidity.
